# Recipe: Oven Spinach and Feta Pie

## Introduction
Oven Spinach and Feta Pie is a delicious and nutritious dish that combines the flavors of spinach, feta cheese, and aromatic herbs. This savory pie is a popular Mediterranean dish and can be enjoyed as a main course or a side dish. The combination of spinach and feta creates a creamy and tangy filling, encased in a flaky pastry crust.

## Ingredients
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1 package (9-inch) refrigerated pie crusts

## Equipment
- Mixing bowl
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Skillet
- Rolling pin
- Pie dish
- Oven

## Preparation Time
- 15 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 30 minutes

## Steps
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
3. Add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
4. In a mixing bowl, combine the cooked spinach, crumbled feta cheese, dried oregano, dried thyme, salt, and pepper. Mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
5. Roll out one pie crust on a lightly floured surface using a rolling pin. Transfer the rolled crust to a greased pie dish, pressing it gently against the sides and bottom.
6. Spoon the spinach and feta mixture into the pie crust, spreading it evenly.
7. Roll out the second pie crust and place it on top of the filling. Trim any excess crust and crimp the edges to seal the pie.
8. Cut a few slits on the top crust to allow steam to escape during baking.
9. Place the pie dish on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
10. Remove the pie from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Oven Spinach and Feta Pie as a main course, accompanied by a fresh green salad.
- This pie can also be enjoyed as a side dish with grilled chicken or fish.

## Variations
- Add diced tomatoes or roasted red peppers to the spinach and feta mixture for added flavor and color.
- Substitute the feta cheese with goat cheese or ricotta for a different taste.
- Incorporate some cooked bacon or ham into the filling for a meatier version of the pie.

## Tips and Tricks
- Make sure to squeeze out any excess moisture from the cooked spinach to prevent the pie from becoming soggy.
- If you prefer a homemade pie crust, you can make one from scratch using your favorite recipe.
- For a vegetarian version, use a vegetable-based pie crust instead of a traditional one made with lard or butter.

## Nutritional Information
- Each serving of Oven Spinach and Feta Pie (1/8 of the pie) contains approximately:
  - Calories: 220
  - Fat: 14g
  - Carbohydrates: 17g
  - Protein: 7g
  - Fiber: 2g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Leftover Oven Spinach and Feta Pie can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- To reheat, place a slice of pie in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 10-15 minutes, or until warmed through.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- Can I use frozen spinach instead of fresh?
  - Yes, you can use frozen spinach. Thaw and squeeze out the excess moisture before using it in the recipe.
- Can I freeze the pie before baking?
  - Yes, you can assemble the pie and freeze it before baking. When ready to bake, simply thaw it in the refrigerator overnight and follow the baking instructions as usual.
- Can I use a different type of cheese?
  - Absolutely! Feel free to experiment with different cheeses like mozzarella, cheddar, or Gruyere to customize the flavors to your liking.
